Pandoc Markdown

Overview

Pandoc understands an extended and slightly revised version of John Gruber’s Markdown syntax. Markdown is designed to be easy to write, and, even more importantly, easy to read:

A Markdown-formatted document should be publishable as-is, as plain text, without looking like it’s been marked up with tags or formatting instructions. – John Gruber

This document provides a high-level summary of the most commonly used markdown syntax. See the full documentation of Pandoc’s Markdown for more in-depth documentation.

https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/blob/master/keynotes/rmarkdown-2.0.key

Markdown Syntax Output 
*italics* and **bold**
 italics and bold 
`verbatim code`
 verbatim code 
$$E = mc^{2}$$
 \(E = mc^{2}\)
Document Options
Figures and Layout
